com.wx.crypto

Class CryptoUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.wx.crypto.CryptoUtil

  • public class CryptoUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    This is an utility class containing useful methods and attributes for encryption/decryption.

    • Method Detail

      • generateRandomSalt

        public static byte[] generateRandomSalt(int size)

      • setCipherSalt

        @Deprecated
public static void setCipherSalt(char[] salt)
        Deprecated. 
        Sets the default salt used for generating Cipher keys.
        Warning: If the salt changes, generated key will change.
        Make sure to always use the same salt.
        Parameters:
        salt - Salt to use
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the salt is less than MIN_SALT_LENGTH characters long

      • setHashSalt

        @Deprecated
public static void setHashSalt(char[] salt)
        Deprecated. 
        Sets the default salt used for generating Hashes.
        Warning: If the salt changes, generated key will change.
        Make sure to always use the same salt.
        Parameters:
        salt - Salt to use
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the salt is less than MIN_SALT_LENGTH characters long * @deprecated

      • getSupportedCryterAlgorithms

        public static Crypter[] getSupportedCryterAlgorithms()
        Returns:
        An array containing an instance of each supported crypter. Those crypter do not contain any key and that must be generated before use.

      • encodeHex

        public static java.lang.String encodeHex(byte[] data)
        Encodes the given bytes into an hexadecimal representation.
        Parameters:
        data - Bytes to encode
        Returns:
        A String representation of the hexadecimal encoded bytes

      • decodeHex

        public static byte[] decodeHex(char[] data)
                        throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Converts an array of characters representing hexadecimal values into an array of bytes of those same values. The returned array will be half the length of the passed array, as it takes two characters to represent any given byte. An exception is thrown if the passed char array has an odd number of elements.
        Parameters:
        data - An array of characters containing hexadecimal digits
        Returns:
        A byte array containing binary data decoded from the supplied char array.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - Thrown if an odd number or illegal of characters is supplied

      • toDigit

        protected static int toDigit(char ch,
                             int index)
                      throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Converts a hexadecimal character to an integer.
        Parameters:
        ch - A character to convert to an integer digit
        index - The index of the character in the source
        Returns:
        An integer
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - Thrown if ch is an illegal hex character
